abstract: Ewing sarcoma (ES)/primitive neuroectodermal tumors (PNET) are known to occur at both central and peripheral locations, as well as at skeletal and extraskeletal sites. They most commonly occur in the first 2 decades of life. We report a rare case of congenital Ewing sarcoma/primitive neuroectodermal tumor arising from the scapula.
title: A rare case of congenital Ewing sarcoma/PNET of the scapula.
